passages.trns: Before the modern world had begun, there was only water and air.
passages.text: Sohē, ne ate okōwcā tōm²en zōlsa, beih alūn in nīen.
passages.phnt: sɔˈeː ne ˈate oˈkoʍt͜ʃaː ˈtoːmən̥ ˈt͜sol̥sa beɪ̯ aˈlun̥ ɪn̥ ˈnijən̥

exist-$pst.$ind $loc front-$posd.$sg $refl.$t-begin-$prf-$npst.$ind world-$absl.$sg be_modern-$npst.$attr only water-$absl.$sg and air-$absl.$sg

passages.trns: There existed a stark division bounded only by the ocean's surface: above the surface, stretched infinitely upwards, was the light blue of sky, and below the surface, stretched infinitely downwards, was the dark blue of sea.
passages.text: Sohē nomēn butla namurpārra mo beih rih² sildūr: t²ē ne rih²met²en, otletī sulī sū met²en, tīrōn²sarrēn, t²ē ne rih²sār, otletī sulī sū sār, masouhresarrēn.
passages.phnt: sɔˈeː noˈmen̥ ˈbut͜ɬa namʊrˈparra mo beɪ̯ rɪ ˈsɪlður̥ teː ne rɪˈmetən̥ ˈot͜ɬetiː suˈliː suː ˈmetən tiːˈron̥sɑrren̥ teː ne rɪˈsar̥ ˈotɬetiː suˈliː suː sar̥ masoʊ̯reˈsɑrren̥

passages.trns: The sea was content in the arrangement, because the whole of the sky was laid bare for her to see - but the sky, however, did not share the sentiment.
passages.text: Rozlē mās ya dēlun²kēn, ko cēz ollā passa tiyen millē ne ate rān ya em²ā - īs nūhuē paquē on tiyen ten serlikīn.
passages.phnt: ˈrɔt͜sleː mas ʝa ˈdeːlʊŋ̥ken̥ ko t͜ʃet͜s ˈɔllaː ˈpɑssa ˈtiʝən̥ ne ˈate ran̥ eˈmaː is ˈnuːʋeː paˈkʷeː ɔn̥ ˈtiʝən̥ tɛn̥ ˈsɛrlikin̥

passages.trns: The sea's water was naturally murky, and the blue light of the sky could not penetrate it more than a few paces.
passages.text: Quorē ko ohopram²i masalūn, in īs sūkiztē tīrōn²sarrēn tūrrī demī sū sin xumi.

data: quor-ē           ko    oh-opram²-i-Ø                   mas-alu-:n        in  īs  Ø-sūkizt-ē           tī-rōn²-sarr-e-:n                 tūrr-ī      demī sū  sin xu-mi

passages.trns: The sky knew that the sea must be harboring an infinite abyss of mysteries beneath her surface, and grew more and more jealous as millenia passed by.
passages.text: Lahuē tiyen sakā on mās isutēn sula sa-t²a silhuahuin ne sar orih², in peskī-peskelatē alen ko aldā bāmissīn.

data: Ø-lahu-ē           tiy-en      Ø-sak-ā             on      ma<:>s       isute-:n      sul-a                 sa=t²-a           silhua-huin     ne  sar-Ø               o-rih²-Ø               in  pesk-ī=peske-lat-ē                       al-en      ko    ald-ā            bāmissi-:n

passages.trns: The sky soon developed a plan by which he would take the sea's waters for his own.
passages.text: Tanē necī tiyen alōs ko-itōhcenā alen masalumi ya opār.

passages.trns: With the breadth of the northern winds, the sky secretly gathered the grains of sand that floated to the surface and joined them together into a black stone.
passages.text: Isommē, modī posi alekterotosin, tiyen zenzī kelapobumi yosa sū rit²en in īhtlūnē alen sū izen xalla.

passages.trns: With the heat of the southern winds, the sky blew fire into the black stone, and when it was sufficiently heated, dropped it into the waters below.
passages.text: Muzē, modī kum²i nizsarrotosin, tiyen kēs sū xallizen, in enseyē, ne lo kun²yerā cinī, sū alumi ne sār.

passages.trns: The sea boiled and the water turned to steam, rising into skies above.

passages.trns: The sky's light blue became dark and grey until the dividing line in the horizon was no longer visible.
passages.text: Ouhrelatē in izm²elatē tīrōen sū tlete īs en²rasā lī arkōn inoma ne meihsem²ēn.

passages.trns: But the sky had taken more than he could hold, and the air grew heavy and dense.

passages.trns: A great storm brew in the heavens above, and the sky's jealous pursuit collapsed into a deafening display of rain and thunder.
passages.text: Otobē tauntēs nuza ne tiyē ne met²en, in ukictē huōte peska tiyen sū raīn berōkra t²a suhtēn in picūn.

passages.trns: The waters below became violent, with waves rising like mountains and towering white foam clashing against lightning strikes.

passages.trns: Movement was brought to the world, and the storm would wage for a four-hundred years before the sky became clear again.
passages.text: Mahterē ya tōm²en saxīn, in otiznenē tauntēs ko īctin morna ne ate narlatā tiyen sicē.

passages.trns: All the while, the black stone of the sky sank further and further into the deep.
